Appendix A Related Work

There are several other related works. Dutta et al., (2018) explore the error-runtime trade-offs in Distributed SGD, revealing how slower and stale gradients can sometimes enhance convergence processes. Woodworth et al., (2020) compare Local SGD with Minibatch SGD, analyzing the efficiency of local updates in different distributed settings. Wu et al., (2022) advance the understanding of asynchronous methods by proposing delay-adaptive step-sizes that adjust to asynchronous learning environments, optimizing the convergence rates. Furthermore, Hanna et al., (2022, 2020) focus on adaptive stochastic gradient descent to improve communication efficiency in distributed learning, offering strategies that reduce communication demands while maintaining fast convergence.

Appendix B Table of Frequently Used Notation

Appendix C Heterogeneous Regime

So far, we have discussed the scenario where all workers compute i.i.d. stochastic gradients. However, in distributed optimization and federated learning (Konečný et al., , 2016), workers may have different datasets. Consider the following optimization problem:

minx∈ℝd⁡{f⁢(x):=1n⁢∑i=1n𝔼ξi∼𝒟i⁢[fi⁢(x;ξi)]},subscript𝑥superscriptℝ𝑑assign𝑓𝑥1𝑛superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛subscript𝔼similar-tosubscript𝜉𝑖subscript𝒟𝑖delimited-[]subscript𝑓𝑖𝑥subscript𝜉𝑖\displaystyle\min_{x\in\mathbb{R}^{d}}\Big{\{}f(x):=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}{% \mathbb{E}}_{\xi_{i}\sim\mathcal{D}_{i}}\left[f_{i}(x;\xi_{i})\right]\Big{\}},roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_f ( italic_x ) := divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∼ caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ; italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] } , (5)

where fi:ℝd×𝕊i→ℝd:subscript𝑓𝑖→superscriptℝ𝑑subscript𝕊𝑖superscriptℝ𝑑f_{i}\,:\,\mathbb{R}^{d}\times\mathbb{S}_{i}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}^{d}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT × blackboard_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT → blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and ξisubscript𝜉𝑖\xi_{i}italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are random variables with some distributions 𝒟isubscript𝒟𝑖\mathcal{D}_{i}caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT on 𝕊isubscript𝕊𝑖\mathbb{S}_{i}blackboard_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Problem (5) generalizes problem (1).

C.1 Related work and discussion

The optimization problem (5) has been thoroughly studied in many papers, including (Aytekin et al., , 2016; Mishchenko et al., , 2018; Nguyen et al., , 2022; Wu et al., , 2022; Koloskova et al., , 2022; Mishchenko et al., , 2022). There have been attempts to analyze Asynchronous SGD in the heterogeneous setting. For example, Mishchenko et al., (2022) demonstrated convergence only to a neighborhood of the solution. In general, achieving good rates for Asynchronous SGD is difficult without making additional assumptions about the similarity of the functions fisubscript𝑓𝑖f_{i}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (Koloskova et al., , 2022; Mishchenko et al., , 2022).

In the deterministic case, when σ2=0superscript𝜎20\sigma^{2}=0italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 0, Wu et al., (2022) analyzed the PIAG method in the deterministic heterogeneous regime and showed convergence. Although the performance of PIAG can be good in practice, in the worst case PIAG requires O⁡(τn⁢L^⁢Δ/ε)Osubscript𝜏𝑛^𝐿Δ𝜀\operatorname{O}\left(\nicefrac{{\tau_{n}\widehat{L}\Delta}}{{\varepsilon}}\right)roman_O ( / start_ARG italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_L end_ARG roman_Δ end_ARG start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG ) seconds to converge, where τnsubscript𝜏𝑛\tau_{n}italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the time delay of the slowest worker, L^:=∑i=1nLi2,assign^𝐿superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛superscriptsubscript𝐿𝑖2\widehat{L}:=\sqrt{\sum_{i=1}^{n}L_{i}^{2}},over^ start_ARG italic_L end_ARG := square-root start_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG , and Lisubscript𝐿𝑖L_{i}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a Lipschitz constant of ∇fi∇subscript𝑓𝑖\nabla f_{i}∇ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Note that the synchronous Minibatch SGD (see Section 1.1) method has the complexity O⁡(τn⁢L⁢Δ/ε)Osubscript𝜏𝑛𝐿Δ𝜀\operatorname{O}\left(\nicefrac{{\tau_{n}L\Delta}}{{\varepsilon}}\right)roman_O ( / start_ARG italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L roman_Δ end_ARG start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG ), which is always better.888In the nonconvex case, L^^𝐿\widehat{L}over^ start_ARG italic_L end_ARG can be arbitrarily larger than L𝐿Litalic_L.

Tyurin and Richtárik, (2024) proposed an optimal method in the regime where worker computation times are deterministic, similar to the homogeneous setup.

C.2 Vecna SGD

Here we describe our method called Vecna SGD.

The Vecna SGD algorithm begins with an initialization at a starting point x0superscript𝑥0x^{0}italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT in ℝdsuperscriptℝ𝑑\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, with a specified stepsize γ𝛾\gammaitalic_γ, time allowances tisubscript𝑡𝑖t_{i}italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and trial counts Bisubscript𝐵𝑖B_{i}italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for each client. In each iteration k𝑘kitalic_k, ranging from k=1𝑘1k=1italic_k = 1 to K𝐾Kitalic_K, the server distributes the current point xksuperscript𝑥𝑘x^{k}italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to all clients. Each client i𝑖iitalic_i then executes a subroutine (Algorithm 4) to attempt to compute Bisubscript𝐵𝑖B_{i}italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT stochastic gradients from samples ξijsuperscriptsubscript𝜉𝑖𝑗\xi_{i}^{j}italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT drawn from a distribution 𝒟𝒟\mathcal{D}caligraphic_D. During each attempt, client i𝑖iitalic_i starts computing a stochastic gradient; if the computation exceeds the allotted time tisubscript𝑡𝑖t_{i}italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, they discard the current gradient and begin another computation. Consequently, the actual number of stochastic gradients received from each client i𝑖iitalic_i becomes a random variable, ranging from 0 to Bisubscript𝐵𝑖B_{i}italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. The expected number of gradients from client i𝑖iitalic_i is given by pi⁢Bisubscript𝑝𝑖subscript𝐵𝑖p_{i}B_{i}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. The server normalizes the gradients by the expected batch size pi⁢Bisubscript𝑝𝑖subscript𝐵𝑖p_{i}B_{i}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and then aggregates them. Finally, the point is updated to xk+1=xk−γ⁢gksuperscript𝑥𝑘1superscript𝑥𝑘𝛾superscript𝑔𝑘x^{k+1}=x^{k}-\gamma g^{k}italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_γ italic_g start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT following each aggregation round.

C.3 Convergence theory

The following theorem gives iterations guarantees for the convergence of Vecna SGD.

Theorem C.1 (Proof in Section H.1).

Assume that Assumptions 4.1, 4.2 hold for the function f𝑓fitalic_f and 4.3 holds for the function fisubscript𝑓𝑖f_{i}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for all i∈[n]𝑖delimited-[]𝑛i\in[n]italic_i ∈ [ italic_n ]. Let γ=min⁡{1L⁢α⁢K,1L⁢β,ε2⁢L⁢ζ}𝛾1𝐿𝛼𝐾1𝐿𝛽𝜀2𝐿𝜁\gamma=\min\left\{\frac{1}{\sqrt{L\alpha K}},\frac{1}{L\beta},\frac{% \varepsilon}{2L\zeta}\right\}italic_γ = roman_min { divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_L italic_α italic_K end_ARG end_ARG , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_L italic_β end_ARG , divide start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_L italic_ζ end_ARG } in Footnote 10. Then after

K≥12⁢Δ⁢Lε⁢max⁡{β,12⁢Δ⁢αε,2⁢ζε},𝐾12Δ𝐿𝜀𝛽12Δ𝛼𝜀2𝜁𝜀\displaystyle K\geq\frac{12\Delta L}{\varepsilon}\max\left\{\beta,\frac{12% \Delta\alpha}{\varepsilon},\frac{2\zeta}{\varepsilon}\right\},italic_K ≥ divide start_ARG 12 roman_Δ italic_L end_ARG start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG roman_max { italic_β , divide start_ARG 12 roman_Δ italic_α end_ARG start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG , divide start_ARG 2 italic_ζ end_ARG start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG } ,

iterations, the method guarantees that min0≤k≤K⁡𝔼⁢[‖∇f⁢(xk)‖2]≤εsubscript0𝑘𝐾𝔼delimited-[]superscriptnorm∇𝑓superscript𝑥𝑘2𝜀\min_{0\leq k\leq K}\mathbb{E}\left[\left\|\nabla f(x^{k})\right\|^{2}\right]\leq\varepsilonroman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 ≤ italic_k ≤ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E [ ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ≤ italic_ε, where Δ=f⁢(x0)−finfΔ𝑓subscript𝑥0superscript𝑓infimum\Delta=f(x_{0})-f^{\inf}roman_Δ = italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_inf end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and

α=Ln2⁢∑i=1n1−pipi⁢Bi,β=1,ζ=σ2n2⁢∑i=1n1pi⁢Bi.formulae-sequence𝛼𝐿superscript𝑛2superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛1subscript𝑝𝑖subscript𝑝𝑖subscript𝐵𝑖formulae-sequence𝛽1𝜁superscript𝜎2superscript𝑛2superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛1subscript𝑝𝑖subscript𝐵𝑖\alpha=\frac{L}{n^{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\frac{1-p_{i}}{p_{i}B_{i}},\quad\beta=1,% \quad\zeta=\frac{\sigma^{2}}{n^{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\frac{1}{p_{i}B_{i}}.italic_α = divide start_ARG italic_L end_ARG start_ARG italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG , italic_β = 1 , italic_ζ = divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG .

C.4 Time Complexity

The following theorem gives time complexity for Vecna SGD.

Theorem C.2 (Proof in Section H.2).

Assume that Assumptions 4.1, 4.2 hold for the function f𝑓fitalic_f and 4.3 holds for the function fisubscript𝑓𝑖f_{i}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for all i∈[n]𝑖delimited-[]𝑛i\in[n]italic_i ∈ [ italic_n ]. Let γ=min⁡{1L⁢α⁢K,1L,ε2⁢L}𝛾1𝐿𝛼𝐾1𝐿𝜀2𝐿\gamma=\min\left\{\frac{1}{\sqrt{L\alpha K}},\frac{1}{L},\frac{\varepsilon}{2L% }\right\}italic_γ = roman_min { divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_L italic_α italic_K end_ARG end_ARG , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_L end_ARG , divide start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_L end_ARG } in Footnote 10, where

α=Ln2⁢∑i=1n1−pipi⁢Bi,ζ=σ2n2⁢∑i=1n1pi⁢Bi.formulae-sequence𝛼𝐿superscript𝑛2superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛1subscript𝑝𝑖subscript𝑝𝑖subscript𝐵𝑖𝜁superscript𝜎2superscript𝑛2superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛1subscript𝑝𝑖subscript𝐵𝑖\alpha=\frac{L}{n^{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\frac{1-p_{i}}{p_{i}B_{i}},\quad\zeta=% \frac{\sigma^{2}}{n^{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\frac{1}{p_{i}B_{i}}.italic_α = divide start_ARG italic_L end_ARG start_ARG italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG , italic_ζ = divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG .

Let t=(t1,…,tn)𝑡subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑛t=\left(t_{1},\ldots,t_{n}\right)italic_t = ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), t1,…,tn≥0subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑛0t_{1},\ldots,t_{n}\geq 0italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≥ 0. Without loss of generality assume that 0<τ1+t1≤⋯≤τn+tn0subscript𝜏1subscript𝑡1⋯subscript𝜏𝑛subscript𝑡𝑛0<\tau_{1}+t_{1}\leq\cdots\leq\tau_{n}+t_{n}0 < italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ ⋯ ≤ italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Let

T=τn+tn+[1n⁢∑i=1nτi+tipi]⁢σ2n⁢ε+[1n⁢∑i=1n1−pipi⁢(τi+ti)]⁢Δ⁢Ln⁢ε,𝑇subscript𝜏𝑛subscript𝑡𝑛delimited-[]1𝑛superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛subscript𝜏𝑖subscript𝑡𝑖subscript𝑝𝑖superscript𝜎2𝑛𝜀delimited-[]1𝑛superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛1subscript𝑝𝑖subscript𝑝𝑖subscript𝜏𝑖subscript𝑡𝑖Δ𝐿𝑛𝜀T=\tau_{n}+t_{n}+\left[\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\frac{\tau_{i}+t_{i}}{p_{i}}% \right]\frac{\sigma^{2}}{n\varepsilon}+\left[\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\frac{1-% p_{i}}{p_{i}}\left(\tau_{i}+t_{i}\right)\right]\frac{\Delta L}{n\varepsilon},italic_T = italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + [ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ] divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_n italic_ε end_ARG + [ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ( italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] divide start_ARG roman_Δ italic_L end_ARG start_ARG italic_n italic_ε end_ARG ,

where Δ=f⁢(x0)−finfΔ𝑓subscript𝑥0superscript𝑓infimum\Delta=f(x_{0})-f^{\inf}roman_Δ = italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_inf end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Put

Bi=⌈bi⌉,bi=Tτi+ti.formulae-sequencesubscript𝐵𝑖subscript𝑏𝑖subscript𝑏𝑖𝑇subscript𝜏𝑖subscript𝑡𝑖B_{i}=\lceil b_{i}\rceil,\quad b_{i}=\frac{T}{\tau_{i}+t_{i}}.italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ⌈ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⌉ , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG italic_T end_ARG start_ARG italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG .

Then, Vecna SGD guarantees to find an ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ-stationary point after

T𝖵𝖾𝖼𝗇𝖺𝖲𝖦𝖣⁢(t)≥288×Δ⁢Lε⁢(τn+tn+[1n⁢∑i=1nτi+tipi]⁢σ2n⁢ε+[1n⁢∑i=1n1−pipi⁢(τi+ti)]⁢Δ⁢Ln⁢ε)subscript𝑇𝖵𝖾𝖼𝗇𝖺𝖲𝖦𝖣𝑡288Δ𝐿𝜀subscript𝜏𝑛subscript𝑡𝑛delimited-[]1𝑛superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛subscript𝜏𝑖subscript𝑡𝑖subscript𝑝𝑖superscript𝜎2𝑛𝜀delimited-[]1𝑛superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛1subscript𝑝𝑖subscript𝑝𝑖subscript𝜏𝑖subscript𝑡𝑖Δ𝐿𝑛𝜀T_{{{\sf\footnotesize\color[rgb]{0.75390625,0,0}\definecolor[named]{% pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0.75390625,0,0}VecnaSGD}}}(t)\geq 288\times\frac{\Delta L% }{\varepsilon}\left(\tau_{n}+t_{n}+\left[\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\frac{\tau_{% i}+t_{i}}{p_{i}}\right]\frac{\sigma^{2}}{n\varepsilon}+\left[\frac{1}{n}\sum_{% i=1}^{n}\frac{1-p_{i}}{p_{i}}\left(\tau_{i}+t_{i}\right)\right]\frac{\Delta L}% {n\varepsilon}\right)italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_VecnaSGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ≥ 288 × divide start_ARG roman_Δ italic_L end_ARG start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG ( italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + [ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ] divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_n italic_ε end_ARG + [ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ( italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] divide start_ARG roman_Δ italic_L end_ARG start_ARG italic_n italic_ε end_ARG )

seconds.

Appendix D The Rennala Algorithm

We mention the Rennala SGD throughout the paper, here we provide a brief introduction to the method and its development. Algorithm 5 shows the work done by the server. Essentially, the server asynchronously waits to collect a batch of size S𝑆Sitalic_S, whenever it receives a gradient from a worker that has the same iteration as the algorithm, it assigns it to compute a gradient at the same point xksubscript𝑥𝑘x_{k}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. After collecting the batch, we preform a synchronous update (given that all gradients were made on the same point xksubscript𝑥𝑘x_{k}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT), using an average of the collected batch.

Appendix E The Classical SGD Theory

In this section, we present the classical SGD theory as developed by Ghadimi and Lan, (2013) and Khaled and Richtárik, (2020). Our analysis will follow the approach of the latter.

We consider the stochastic gradient descent (SGD) method:

xk+1=xk−γ⁢g⁢(xk),superscript𝑥𝑘1superscript𝑥𝑘𝛾𝑔superscript𝑥𝑘x^{k+1}=x^{k}-\gamma g(x^{k}),italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_γ italic_g ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ,

where x0∈ℝdsuperscript𝑥0superscriptℝ𝑑x^{0}\in\mathbb{R}^{d}italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the initial point, and g⁢(x)𝑔𝑥g(x)italic_g ( italic_x ) is a stochastic gradient estimator at x𝑥xitalic_x.

We make the following assumption:

Assumption E.1.

The stochastic gradient estimator g⁢(x)𝑔𝑥g(x)italic_g ( italic_x ) satisfies:

𝔼⁢[g⁢(x)]=∇f⁢(x)𝔼delimited-[]𝑔𝑥∇𝑓𝑥\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[g(x)\right]=\nabla f(x)blackboard_E [ italic_g ( italic_x ) ] = ∇ italic_f ( italic_x )
𝔼⁢[‖g⁢(x)‖2]≤2⁢α⁢(f⁢(x)−finf)+β⁢‖∇f⁢(x)‖2+ζ,𝔼delimited-[]superscriptnorm𝑔𝑥22𝛼𝑓𝑥superscript𝑓infimum𝛽superscriptnorm∇𝑓𝑥2𝜁\displaystyle{\mathbb{E}}\left[\left\|g(x)\right\|^{2}\right]\leq 2\alpha\left% (f(x)-f^{\inf}\right)+\beta\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|^{2}+\zeta,blackboard_E [ ∥ italic_g ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ≤ 2 italic_α ( italic_f ( italic_x ) - italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_inf end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_β ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_ζ ,

for all x∈ℝd𝑥superscriptℝ𝑑x\in\mathbb{R}^{d}italic_x ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and some constants α,β,ζ≥0𝛼𝛽𝜁0\alpha,\beta,\zeta\geq 0italic_α , italic_β , italic_ζ ≥ 0.

This assumption is both general and reasonable, and it is satisfied by many modern SGD-type methods. For further details, refer to Khaled and Richtárik, (2020).

Under this assumption, we can derive the following convergence result.

Theorem E.2 (Corollary 1 (Khaled and Richtárik, , 2020)).

Assume that Assumptions 4.1, 4.2 and E.1 hold. Then for any ε>0𝜀0\varepsilon>0italic_ε > 0

min0≤k≤K⁡𝔼⁢[‖∇f⁢(xk)‖2]≤εsubscript0𝑘𝐾𝔼delimited-[]superscriptnorm∇𝑓superscript𝑥𝑘2𝜀\displaystyle\min_{0\leq k\leq K}\mathbb{E}\left[\left\|\nabla f(x^{k})\right% \|^{2}\right]\leq\varepsilonroman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 ≤ italic_k ≤ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E [ ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ≤ italic_ε

for

γ=min⁡{1L⁢α⁢K,1L⁢β,ε2⁢L⁢ζ},𝛾1𝐿𝛼𝐾1𝐿𝛽𝜀2𝐿𝜁\displaystyle\gamma=\min\left\{\frac{1}{\sqrt{L\alpha K}},\frac{1}{L\beta},% \frac{\varepsilon}{2L\zeta}\right\},italic_γ = roman_min { divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_L italic_α italic_K end_ARG end_ARG , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_L italic_β end_ARG , divide start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_L italic_ζ end_ARG } ,

and

K≥12⁢L⁢(f⁢(x0)−finf)ε⁢max⁡{β,12⁢Δ⁢αε,2⁢ζε}.𝐾12𝐿𝑓subscript𝑥0superscript𝑓infimum𝜀𝛽12Δ𝛼𝜀2𝜁𝜀\displaystyle K\geq\frac{12L\left(f(x_{0})-f^{\inf}\right)}{\varepsilon}\max% \left\{\beta,\frac{12\Delta\alpha}{\varepsilon},\frac{2\zeta}{\varepsilon}% \right\}.italic_K ≥ divide start_ARG 12 italic_L ( italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_inf end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG roman_max { italic_β , divide start_ARG 12 roman_Δ italic_α end_ARG start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG , divide start_ARG 2 italic_ζ end_ARG start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG } .

Appendix F Proofs for Propositions in Section 3

Proposition 3.1.

Let K𝐾Kitalic_K be the number of iterations required by Rennala SGD to find an ε𝜀\varepsilonitalic_ε-stationary point. Then, for sufficiently small ε𝜀\varepsilonitalic_ε, MindFlayer SGD needs K/p𝐾𝑝K/pitalic_K / italic_p iterations to find an ε𝜀\varepsilonitalic_ε-stationary point.

Proof.

The iterations of Rennala SGD can be viewed as iterations of Minibatch SGD. Thus, we can apply the classical SGD theory (Theorem E.2) to derive its iteration complexity:

K=max⁡{1,σ2ε⁢B}⁢8⁢L⁢(f⁢(x0)−finf)ε.𝐾1superscript𝜎2𝜀𝐵8𝐿𝑓superscript𝑥0superscript𝑓infimum𝜀K=\max\left\{1,\frac{\sigma^{2}}{\varepsilon B}\right\}\frac{8L(f(x^{0})-f^{% \inf})}{\varepsilon}.italic_K = roman_max { 1 , divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_ε italic_B end_ARG } divide start_ARG 8 italic_L ( italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_inf end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG .

For MindFlayer SGD, the iteration complexity follows from Theorem 4.4. Therefore, the number of iterations KMsubscript𝐾𝑀K_{M}italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT required for MindFlayer SGD to guarantee that

1KM⁢∑k=0KM−1𝔼⁢[‖∇f⁢(xk)‖2]≤ε1subscript𝐾𝑀superscriptsubscript𝑘0subscript𝐾𝑀1𝔼delimited-[]superscriptnorm∇𝑓superscript𝑥𝑘2𝜀\frac{1}{K_{M}}\sum_{k=0}^{K_{M}-1}{\mathbb{E}}\left[\left\|\nabla f(x^{k})% \right\|^{2}\right]\leq\varepsilondivide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E [ ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ≤ italic_ε

is given by

KM=max⁡{1,σ2ε⁢B⁢p}⁢8⁢L⁢(f⁢(x0)−finf)ε.subscript𝐾𝑀1superscript𝜎2𝜀𝐵𝑝8𝐿𝑓superscript𝑥0superscript𝑓infimum𝜀K_{M}=\max\left\{1,\frac{\sigma^{2}}{\varepsilon Bp}\right\}\frac{8L(f(x^{0})-% f^{\inf})}{\varepsilon}.italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_max { 1 , divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_ε italic_B italic_p end_ARG } divide start_ARG 8 italic_L ( italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_inf end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG .

If ε≤σ2B𝜀superscript𝜎2𝐵\varepsilon\leq\frac{\sigma^{2}}{B}italic_ε ≤ divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG, we have

KM=Kp.subscript𝐾𝑀𝐾𝑝K_{M}=\frac{K}{p}.italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_p end_ARG .

∎

Proposition 3.3.

For the n=1𝑛1n=1italic_n = 1 case, if s>τ+Med⁢[η]𝑠𝜏Meddelimited-[]𝜂s>\tau+\mathrm{Med}[\eta]italic_s > italic_τ + roman_Med [ italic_η ] then MindFlayer SGD is faster than Rennala SGD. Moreover, if s=(τ+Med⁢[η])⁢(2⁢α−1)𝑠𝜏Meddelimited-[]𝜂2𝛼1s=\left(\tau+\mathrm{Med}[\eta]\right)\left(2\alpha-1\right)italic_s = ( italic_τ + roman_Med [ italic_η ] ) ( 2 italic_α - 1 ) then

T𝖱𝖾𝗇𝗇𝖺𝗅𝖺𝖲𝖦𝖣T𝖬𝗂𝗇𝖽𝖥𝗅𝖺𝗒𝖾𝗋𝖲𝖦𝖣⁢(Med⁢[η])≥α.subscript𝑇𝖱𝖾𝗇𝗇𝖺𝗅𝖺𝖲𝖦𝖣subscript𝑇𝖬𝗂𝗇𝖽𝖥𝗅𝖺𝗒𝖾𝗋𝖲𝖦𝖣Meddelimited-[]𝜂𝛼\frac{T_{{\sf\footnotesize\color[rgb]{0.75390625,0,0}\definecolor[named]{% pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0.75390625,0,0}RennalaSGD}}}{T_{{\sf\footnotesize\color[% rgb]{0.75390625,0,0}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0.75390625,0,0}% MindFlayerSGD}}\left(\mathrm{Med}[\eta]\right)}\geq\alpha.divide start_ARG italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_RennalaSGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_MindFlayerSGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( roman_Med [ italic_η ] ) end_ARG ≥ italic_α .
Proof.

Let t=Med[η]=:mt=\mathrm{Med}[\eta]=:mitalic_t = roman_Med [ italic_η ] = : italic_m, then we have

T𝖬𝗂𝗇𝖽𝖥𝗅𝖺𝗒𝖾𝗋𝖲𝖦𝖣⁢(m)≤Kp⁢B⁢(τ+t)=2⁢K⁢B⁢(τ+m),subscript𝑇𝖬𝗂𝗇𝖽𝖥𝗅𝖺𝗒𝖾𝗋𝖲𝖦𝖣𝑚𝐾𝑝𝐵𝜏𝑡2𝐾𝐵𝜏𝑚T_{{\sf\footnotesize\color[rgb]{0.75390625,0,0}\definecolor[named]{% pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0.75390625,0,0}MindFlayerSGD}}(m)\leq\frac{K}{p}B(\tau+t)% =2KB\left(\tau+m\right),italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_MindFlayerSGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_m ) ≤ divide start_ARG italic_K end_ARG start_ARG italic_p end_ARG italic_B ( italic_τ + italic_t ) = 2 italic_K italic_B ( italic_τ + italic_m ) ,
T𝖱𝖾𝗇𝗇𝖺𝗅𝖺𝖲𝖦𝖣=K⁢B⁢(τ+𝔼⁢[η])=K⁢B⁢(τ+m+s),subscript𝑇𝖱𝖾𝗇𝗇𝖺𝗅𝖺𝖲𝖦𝖣𝐾𝐵𝜏𝔼delimited-[]𝜂𝐾𝐵𝜏𝑚𝑠T_{{\sf\footnotesize\color[rgb]{0.75390625,0,0}\definecolor[named]{% pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0.75390625,0,0}RennalaSGD}}=KB(\tau+\mathbb{E}\left[\eta% \right])=KB(\tau+m+s),italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_RennalaSGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_K italic_B ( italic_τ + blackboard_E [ italic_η ] ) = italic_K italic_B ( italic_τ + italic_m + italic_s ) ,

Thus if s>τ+m𝑠𝜏𝑚s>\tau+mitalic_s > italic_τ + italic_m then MindFlayer SGD is faster than Rennala SGD.

Now, let s=(τ+m)⁢(2⁢α−1)𝑠𝜏𝑚2𝛼1s=\left(\tau+m\right)\left(2\alpha-1\right)italic_s = ( italic_τ + italic_m ) ( 2 italic_α - 1 ) then

T𝖱𝖾𝗇𝗇𝖺𝗅𝖺𝖲𝖦𝖣T𝖬𝗂𝗇𝖽𝖥𝗅𝖺𝗒𝖾𝗋𝖲𝖦𝖣⁢(m)≥τ+m+s2⁢(τ+m)=2⁢α⁢(τ+m)2⁢(τ+m)=α.subscript𝑇𝖱𝖾𝗇𝗇𝖺𝗅𝖺𝖲𝖦𝖣subscript𝑇𝖬𝗂𝗇𝖽𝖥𝗅𝖺𝗒𝖾𝗋𝖲𝖦𝖣𝑚𝜏𝑚𝑠2𝜏𝑚2𝛼𝜏𝑚2𝜏𝑚𝛼\frac{T_{{\sf\footnotesize\color[rgb]{0.75390625,0,0}\definecolor[named]{% pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0.75390625,0,0}RennalaSGD}}}{T_{{\sf\footnotesize\color[% rgb]{0.75390625,0,0}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0.75390625,0,0}% MindFlayerSGD}}\left(m\right)}\geq\frac{\tau+m+s}{2\left(\tau+m\right)}=\frac{% 2\alpha\left(\tau+m\right)}{2\left(\tau+m\right)}=\alpha.divide start_ARG italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_RennalaSGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_MindFlayerSGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_ARG ≥ divide start_ARG italic_τ + italic_m + italic_s end_ARG start_ARG 2 ( italic_τ + italic_m ) end_ARG = divide start_ARG 2 italic_α ( italic_τ + italic_m ) end_ARG start_ARG 2 ( italic_τ + italic_m ) end_ARG = italic_α .

∎

Appendix G Proofs for Homogeneous Regime

G.1 Proof of Theorem 4.4

First, we rewrite MindFlayer SGD in a classical SGD way where we do gradient step with an unbiased estimator of the gradient at each iteration.

where B=∑i=1npi⁢Bi𝐵superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛subscript𝑝𝑖subscript𝐵𝑖B=\sum_{i=1}^{n}p_{i}B_{i}italic_B = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, pi=F⁢(ti)=P⁢(ηi≤ti)subscript𝑝𝑖𝐹subscript𝑡𝑖𝑃subscript𝜂𝑖subscript𝑡𝑖p_{i}=F(t_{i})=P(\eta_{i}\leq t_{i})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_F ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_P ( italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and I⁢(⋅)𝐼⋅I(\cdot)italic_I ( ⋅ ) denotes the indicator function. To prove the theorem we need to establish some properties of the gradient estimator. First, we need an unbiased estimator.

Lemma G.1 (Proof in Section G.1.1).

The gradient estimator in Algorithm 7 given by

g⁢(x):=1B⁢∑i=1n∑j=1BiI⁢(ηij≤ti)⁢∇f⁢(x;ξij)assign𝑔𝑥1𝐵superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛superscriptsubscript𝑗1subscript𝐵𝑖𝐼superscriptsubscript𝜂𝑖𝑗subscript𝑡𝑖∇𝑓𝑥superscriptsubscript𝜉𝑖𝑗g(x):=\frac{1}{B}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{j=1}^{B_{i}}I\left(\eta_{i}^{j}\leq t_{i}% \right)\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{j}\right)italic_g ( italic_x ) := divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_I ( italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )

is unbiased, i.e., 𝔼⁢[g⁢(x)]=∇f⁢(x)𝔼delimited-[]𝑔𝑥∇𝑓𝑥\mathbb{E}\left[g(x)\right]=\nabla f(x)blackboard_E [ italic_g ( italic_x ) ] = ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ) for all x∈ℝd𝑥superscriptℝ𝑑x\in\mathbb{R}^{d}italic_x ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

Next, we obtain an upper bound for the variance of this estimator.

Lemma G.2 (Proof in Section G.1.2).

The gradient estimator in Algorithm 7 given by

g⁢(x):=1B⁢∑i=1n∑j=1BiI⁢(ηij≤ti)⁢∇f⁢(x;ξij)assign𝑔𝑥1𝐵superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛superscriptsubscript𝑗1subscript𝐵𝑖𝐼superscriptsubscript𝜂𝑖𝑗subscript𝑡𝑖∇𝑓𝑥superscriptsubscript𝜉𝑖𝑗g(x):=\frac{1}{B}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{j=1}^{B_{i}}I\left(\eta_{i}^{j}\leq t_{i}% \right)\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{j}\right)italic_g ( italic_x ) := divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_I ( italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )

satisfies

𝔼⁢[‖g⁢(x)2‖]≤2⁢‖∇f⁢(x)‖2+1B⁢σ2.𝔼delimited-[]norm𝑔superscript𝑥22superscriptnorm∇𝑓𝑥21𝐵superscript𝜎2\mathbb{E}\left[\left\|g(x)^{2}\right\|\right]\leq 2\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|% ^{2}+\frac{1}{B}\sigma^{2}.blackboard_E [ ∥ italic_g ( italic_x ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ ] ≤ 2 ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

We are ready to prove the Theorem 4.4.

Theorem 4.4.

Assume that Assumptions 4.1, 4.2 and 4.3 hold. Let B=∑i=1npi⁢Bi𝐵superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛subscript𝑝𝑖subscript𝐵𝑖B=\sum_{i=1}^{n}p_{i}B_{i}italic_B = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and γ=12⁢L⁢min⁡{1,ε⁢Bσ2}𝛾12𝐿1𝜀𝐵superscript𝜎2\gamma=\frac{1}{2L}\min\left\{1,\frac{\varepsilon B}{\sigma^{2}}\right\}italic_γ = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_L end_ARG roman_min { 1 , divide start_ARG italic_ε italic_B end_ARG start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG } in Footnote 7. Then, after

K≥max⁡{1,σ2ε⁢B}⁢8⁢L⁢(f⁢(x0)−finf)ε𝐾1superscript𝜎2𝜀𝐵8𝐿𝑓superscript𝑥0superscript𝑓infimum𝜀K\geq\max\left\{1,\frac{\sigma^{2}}{\varepsilon B}\right\}\frac{8L\left(f(x^{0% })-f^{\inf}\right)}{\varepsilon}italic_K ≥ roman_max { 1 , divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_ε italic_B end_ARG } divide start_ARG 8 italic_L ( italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_inf end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG

iterations, the method guarantees that 1K⁢∑k=0K−1𝔼⁢[‖∇f⁢(xk)‖2]≤ε1𝐾superscriptsubscript𝑘0𝐾1𝔼delimited-[]superscriptnorm∇𝑓superscript𝑥𝑘2𝜀\frac{1}{K}\sum_{k=0}^{K-1}{\mathbb{E}}\left[\left\|\nabla f(x^{k})\right\|^{2% }\right]\leq\varepsilondivide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_K end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E [ ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ≤ italic_ε.

Proof.

Note that Footnote 7 can be viewed as a special case of classical stochastic gradient descent (SGD), as reformulated in Algorithm 7. We need to verify that the gradient estimator fulfills the conditions required by classical SGD (Theorem E.2). The two preceding lemmas address this requirement precisely. Specifically, Lemma G.1 confirms that the gradient estimator used in Algorithm 7 is unbiased, while Lemma G.2 verifies that the variance of this estimator meets the conditions specified in E.1, with α=0𝛼0\alpha=0italic_α = 0, β=2𝛽2\beta=2italic_β = 2 and ζ=σ2B𝜁superscript𝜎2𝐵\zeta=\frac{\sigma^{2}}{B}italic_ζ = divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG. Consequently, it remains to apply Theorem E.2. ∎

G.1.1 Proof of Lemma G.1

Lemma G.1.

The gradient estimator in Algorithm 7 given by

g⁢(x):=1B⁢∑i=1n∑j=1BiI⁢(ηij≤ti)⁢∇f⁢(x;ξij)assign𝑔𝑥1𝐵superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛superscriptsubscript𝑗1subscript𝐵𝑖𝐼superscriptsubscript𝜂𝑖𝑗subscript𝑡𝑖∇𝑓𝑥superscriptsubscript𝜉𝑖𝑗g(x):=\frac{1}{B}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{j=1}^{B_{i}}I\left(\eta_{i}^{j}\leq t_{i}% \right)\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{j}\right)italic_g ( italic_x ) := divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_I ( italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )

is unbiased, i.e., 𝔼⁢[g⁢(x)]=∇f⁢(x)𝔼delimited-[]𝑔𝑥∇𝑓𝑥\mathbb{E}\left[g(x)\right]=\nabla f(x)blackboard_E [ italic_g ( italic_x ) ] = ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ) for all x∈ℝd𝑥superscriptℝ𝑑x\in\mathbb{R}^{d}italic_x ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, where B=∑i=1npi⁢Bi𝐵superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛subscript𝑝𝑖subscript𝐵𝑖B=\sum_{i=1}^{n}p_{i}B_{i}italic_B = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Proof.

This follows from direct computation:

𝔼⁢[g⁢(x)]𝔼delimited-[]𝑔𝑥\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[g(x)\right]blackboard_E [ italic_g ( italic_x ) ] =\displaystyle== 𝔼⁢[1B⁢∑i=1n∑j=1BiI⁢(ηij≤ti)⁢∇f⁢(x;ξij)]𝔼delimited-[]1𝐵superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛superscriptsubscript𝑗1subscript𝐵𝑖𝐼superscriptsubscript𝜂𝑖𝑗subscript𝑡𝑖∇𝑓𝑥superscriptsubscript𝜉𝑖𝑗\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\frac{1}{B}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{j=1}^{B_{i}}I\left% (\eta_{i}^{j}\leq t_{i}\right)\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{j}\right)\right]blackboard_E [ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_I ( italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ]
=\displaystyle== 1B⁢∑i=1n∑j=1Bi𝔼⁢[I⁢(ηij≤ti)⁢∇f⁢(x;ξij)]1𝐵superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛superscriptsubscript𝑗1subscript𝐵𝑖𝔼delimited-[]𝐼superscriptsubscript𝜂𝑖𝑗subscript𝑡𝑖∇𝑓𝑥superscriptsubscript𝜉𝑖𝑗\displaystyle\frac{1}{B}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{j=1}^{B_{i}}\mathbb{E}\left[I\left% (\eta_{i}^{j}\leq t_{i}\right)\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{j}\right)\right]divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E [ italic_I ( italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ]
=(ηij⟂⟂ξij)\displaystyle\overset{\left(\eta_{i}^{j}\perp\!\!\!\!\perp\xi_{i}^{j}\right)}{=}start_OVERACCENT ( italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⟂ ⟂ italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG = end_ARG 1B⁢∑i=1n∑j=1Bi𝔼⁢[I⁢(ηij≤ti)]⁢𝔼⁢[∇f⁢(x;ξij)]1𝐵superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛superscriptsubscript𝑗1subscript𝐵𝑖𝔼delimited-[]𝐼superscriptsubscript𝜂𝑖𝑗subscript𝑡𝑖𝔼delimited-[]∇𝑓𝑥superscriptsubscript𝜉𝑖𝑗\displaystyle\frac{1}{B}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{j=1}^{B_{i}}\mathbb{E}\left[I\left% (\eta_{i}^{j}\leq t_{i}\right)\right]\mathbb{E}\left[\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{% j}\right)\right]divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E [ italic_I ( italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] blackboard_E [ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ]

=\displaystyle== ∇f⁢(x).∇𝑓𝑥\displaystyle\nabla f(x).∇ italic_f ( italic_x ) .

∎

G.1.2 Proof of Lemma G.2

Lemma G.2.

The gradient estimator in Algorithm 7 given by

g⁢(x):=1B⁢∑i=1n∑j=1BiI⁢(ηij≤ti)⁢∇f⁢(x;ξij)assign𝑔𝑥1𝐵superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛superscriptsubscript𝑗1subscript𝐵𝑖𝐼superscriptsubscript𝜂𝑖𝑗subscript𝑡𝑖∇𝑓𝑥superscriptsubscript𝜉𝑖𝑗g(x):=\frac{1}{B}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{j=1}^{B_{i}}I\left(\eta_{i}^{j}\leq t_{i}% \right)\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{j}\right)italic_g ( italic_x ) := divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_I ( italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )

satisfies

𝔼⁢[‖g⁢(x)2‖]≤2⁢‖∇f⁢(x)‖2+1B⁢σ2,𝔼delimited-[]norm𝑔superscript𝑥22superscriptnorm∇𝑓𝑥21𝐵superscript𝜎2\mathbb{E}\left[\left\|g(x)^{2}\right\|\right]\leq 2\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|% ^{2}+\frac{1}{B}\sigma^{2},blackboard_E [ ∥ italic_g ( italic_x ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ ] ≤ 2 ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,

where B=∑i=1npi⁢Bi𝐵superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛subscript𝑝𝑖subscript𝐵𝑖B=\sum_{i=1}^{n}p_{i}B_{i}italic_B = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Proof.

In order to simplify notation, let

ai:=∑j=1Bibij,assignsubscript𝑎𝑖superscriptsubscript𝑗1subscript𝐵𝑖superscriptsubscript𝑏𝑖𝑗a_{i}:=\sum_{j=1}^{B_{i}}b_{i}^{j},italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT := ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,

where

bij:=I⁢(ηij≤ti)⁢∇f⁢(x;ξij).assignsuperscriptsubscript𝑏𝑖𝑗𝐼superscriptsubscript𝜂𝑖𝑗subscript𝑡𝑖∇𝑓𝑥superscriptsubscript𝜉𝑖𝑗b_{i}^{j}:=I\left(\eta_{i}^{j}\leq t_{i}\right)\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{j}% \right).italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT := italic_I ( italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) .

Step 1 (Initial expression). We express 𝔼⁢[‖g⁢(x)‖2]𝔼delimited-[]superscriptnorm𝑔𝑥2\mathbb{E}\left[\|g(x)\|^{2}\right]blackboard_E [ ∥ italic_g ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] in terms of aisubscript𝑎𝑖a_{i}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT:

𝔼⁢[‖g⁢(x)‖2]𝔼delimited-[]superscriptnorm𝑔𝑥2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\left\|g(x)\right\|^{2}\right]blackboard_E [ ∥ italic_g ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] =\displaystyle== 𝔼⁢[‖1B⁢∑i=1nai‖2]=1B2⁢𝔼⁢[∑i=1n‖ai‖2+∑i≠j⟨ai,aj⟩].𝔼delimited-[]superscriptnorm1𝐵superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛subscript𝑎𝑖21superscript𝐵2𝔼delimited-[]superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛superscriptnormsubscript𝑎𝑖2subscript𝑖𝑗subscript𝑎𝑖subscript𝑎𝑗\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\left\|\frac{1}{B}\sum_{i=1}^{n}a_{i}\right\|^{2}% \right]=\frac{1}{B^{2}}\mathbb{E}\left[\sum_{i=1}^{n}\left\|a_{i}\right\|^{2}+% \sum_{i\neq j}\left\langle a_{i},a_{j}\right\rangle\right].blackboard_E [ ∥ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG blackboard_E [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ≠ italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⟨ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⟩ ] .

We further simplify both terms via:

‖ai‖2=‖∑j=1Bibij‖2=∑j=1Bi‖bij‖2+∑k≠l⟨bik,bil⟩,superscriptnormsubscript𝑎𝑖2superscriptnormsuperscriptsubscript𝑗1subscript𝐵𝑖superscriptsubscript𝑏𝑖𝑗2superscriptsubscript𝑗1subscript𝐵𝑖superscriptnormsuperscriptsubscript𝑏𝑖𝑗2subscript𝑘𝑙superscriptsubscript𝑏𝑖𝑘superscriptsubscript𝑏𝑖𝑙\displaystyle\left\|a_{i}\right\|^{2}=\left\|\sum_{j=1}^{B_{i}}b_{i}^{j}\right% \|^{2}=\sum_{j=1}^{B_{i}}\left\|b_{i}^{j}\right\|^{2}+\sum_{k\neq l}\left% \langle b_{i}^{k},b_{i}^{l}\right\rangle,∥ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ∥ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k ≠ italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⟨ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⟩ , (6)
⟨ai,aj⟩=⟨∑k=1Bibik,∑l=1Bjbjl⟩=∑k=1Bi∑l=1Bj⟨bik,bjl⟩.subscript𝑎𝑖subscript𝑎𝑗superscriptsubscript𝑘1subscript𝐵𝑖superscriptsubscript𝑏𝑖𝑘superscriptsubscript𝑙1subscript𝐵𝑗superscriptsubscript𝑏𝑗𝑙superscriptsubscript𝑘1subscript𝐵𝑖superscriptsubscript𝑙1subscript𝐵𝑗superscriptsubscript𝑏𝑖𝑘superscriptsubscript𝑏𝑗𝑙\displaystyle\left\langle a_{i},a_{j}\right\rangle=\left\langle\sum_{k=1}^{B_{% i}}b_{i}^{k},\sum_{l=1}^{B_{j}}b_{j}^{l}\right\rangle=\sum_{k=1}^{B_{i}}\sum_{% l=1}^{B_{j}}\left\langle b_{i}^{k},b_{j}^{l}\right\rangle.⟨ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⟩ = ⟨ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⟩ = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⟨ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⟩ . (7)

Step 2. (Finding the expectations). Further

𝔼⁢[‖bij‖2]𝔼delimited-[]superscriptnormsuperscriptsubscript𝑏𝑖𝑗2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\left\|b_{i}^{j}\right\|^{2}\right]blackboard_E [ ∥ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] =\displaystyle== 𝔼⁢[(I⁢(ηij≤ti))2⁢‖∇f⁢(x;ξij)‖2]𝔼delimited-[]superscript𝐼superscriptsubscript𝜂𝑖𝑗subscript𝑡𝑖2superscriptnorm∇𝑓𝑥superscriptsubscript𝜉𝑖𝑗2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\left(I\left(\eta_{i}^{j}\leq t_{i}\right)\right)% ^{2}\left\|\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{j}\right)\right\|^{2}\right]blackboard_E [ ( italic_I ( italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] (8)
=(ηij⟂⟂ξij)\displaystyle\overset{\left(\eta_{i}^{j}\perp\!\!\!\!\perp\xi_{i}^{j}\right)}{=}start_OVERACCENT ( italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⟂ ⟂ italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG = end_ARG 𝔼⁢[(I⁢(ηij≤ti))2]⁢𝔼⁢[‖∇f⁢(x;ξij)‖2]𝔼delimited-[]superscript𝐼superscriptsubscript𝜂𝑖𝑗subscript𝑡𝑖2𝔼delimited-[]superscriptnorm∇𝑓𝑥superscriptsubscript𝜉𝑖𝑗2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\left(I\left(\eta_{i}^{j}\leq t_{i}\right)\right)% ^{2}\right]\mathbb{E}\left[\left\|\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{j}\right)\right\|^{% 2}\right]blackboard_E [ ( italic_I ( italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] blackboard_E [ ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]
≤\displaystyle\leq≤ pi⁢(‖∇f⁢(x)‖2+𝔼⁢[‖∇f⁢(x;ξij)−∇f⁢(x)‖2])subscript𝑝𝑖superscriptnorm∇𝑓𝑥2𝔼delimited-[]superscriptnorm∇𝑓𝑥superscriptsubscript𝜉𝑖𝑗∇𝑓𝑥2\displaystyle p_{i}\left(\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|^{2}+\mathbb{E}\left[\left% \|\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{j}\right)-\nabla f(x)\right\|^{2}\right]\right)italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + blackboard_E [ ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] )
≤(4.3)4.3\displaystyle\overset{\left(\lx@cref{creftypecap~refnum}{ass:stochastic_varian% ce_bounded}\right)}{\leq}start_OVERACCENT ( ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG ≤ end_ARG pi⁢(‖∇f⁢(x)‖2+σ2),subscript𝑝𝑖superscriptnorm∇𝑓𝑥2superscript𝜎2\displaystyle p_{i}\left(\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|^{2}+\sigma^{2}\right),italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ,

and

𝔼⁢[⟨bik,bjl⟩]𝔼delimited-[]superscriptsubscript𝑏𝑖𝑘superscriptsubscript𝑏𝑗𝑙\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\left\langle b_{i}^{k},b_{j}^{l}\right\rangle\right]blackboard_E [ ⟨ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⟩ ] =\displaystyle== 𝔼⁢[⟨I⁢(ηik≤ti)⁢∇f⁢(x;ξik),I⁢(ηjl≤tj)⁢∇f⁢(x;ξjl)⟩]𝔼delimited-[]𝐼superscriptsubscript𝜂𝑖𝑘subscript𝑡𝑖∇𝑓𝑥superscriptsubscript𝜉𝑖𝑘𝐼superscriptsubscript𝜂𝑗𝑙subscript𝑡𝑗∇𝑓𝑥superscriptsubscript𝜉𝑗𝑙\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\left\langle I\left(\eta_{i}^{k}\leq t_{i}\right)% \nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{k}\right),I\left(\eta_{j}^{l}\leq t_{j}\right)\nabla f% \left(x;\xi_{j}^{l}\right)\right\rangle\right]blackboard_E [ ⟨ italic_I ( italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) , italic_I ( italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ⟩ ] (9)
=(⟂⟂)perpendicular-toabsentperpendicular-to\displaystyle\overset{\left(\perp\!\!\!\!\perp\right)}{=}start_OVERACCENT ( ⟂ ⟂ ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG = end_ARG 𝔼⁢[I⁢(ηik≤ti)]⁢𝔼⁢[I⁢(ηjl≤tj)]⁢⟨𝔼⁢[∇f⁢(x;ξik)],𝔼⁢[∇f⁢(x;ξjl)]⟩𝔼delimited-[]𝐼superscriptsubscript𝜂𝑖𝑘subscript𝑡𝑖𝔼delimited-[]𝐼superscriptsubscript𝜂𝑗𝑙subscript𝑡𝑗𝔼delimited-[]∇𝑓𝑥superscriptsubscript𝜉𝑖𝑘𝔼delimited-[]∇𝑓𝑥superscriptsubscript𝜉𝑗𝑙\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[I\left(\eta_{i}^{k}\leq t_{i}\right)\right]% \mathbb{E}\left[I\left(\eta_{j}^{l}\leq t_{j}\right)\right]\left\langle\mathbb% {E}\left[\nabla f\left(x;\xi_{i}^{k}\right)\right],\mathbb{E}\left[\nabla f% \left(x;\xi_{j}^{l}\right)\right]\right\rangleblackboard_E [ italic_I ( italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] blackboard_E [ italic_I ( italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] ⟨ blackboard_E [ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] , blackboard_E [ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] ⟩
=\displaystyle== pi⁢pj⁢‖∇f⁢(x)‖2.subscript𝑝𝑖subscript𝑝𝑗superscriptnorm∇𝑓𝑥2\displaystyle p_{i}p_{j}\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|^{2}.italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

Step 3 (Putting everything together). We start with

𝔼⁢[‖ai‖2]𝔼delimited-[]superscriptnormsubscript𝑎𝑖2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\left\|a_{i}\right\|^{2}\right]blackboard_E [ ∥ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ≤(6,8,9)689\displaystyle\overset{\left(\ref{a_i},\ref{b_i},\ref{b_ib_j}\right)}{\leq}start_OVERACCENT ( , , ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG ≤ end_ARG Bi⁢pi⁢(‖∇f⁢(x)‖2+σ2)+Bi⁢(Bi−1)⁢pi2⁢‖∇f⁢(x)‖2subscript𝐵𝑖subscript𝑝𝑖superscriptnorm∇𝑓𝑥2superscript𝜎2subscript𝐵𝑖subscript𝐵𝑖1superscriptsubscript𝑝𝑖2superscriptnorm∇𝑓𝑥2\displaystyle B_{i}p_{i}\left(\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|^{2}+\sigma^{2}\right)% +B_{i}\left(B_{i}-1\right)p_{i}^{2}\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|^{2}italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 ) italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
≤\displaystyle\leq≤ Bi⁢pi⁢(‖∇f⁢(x)‖2+σ2)+Bi2⁢pi2⁢‖∇f⁢(x)‖2,subscript𝐵𝑖subscript𝑝𝑖superscriptnorm∇𝑓𝑥2superscript𝜎2superscriptsubscript𝐵𝑖2superscriptsubscript𝑝𝑖2superscriptnorm∇𝑓𝑥2\displaystyle B_{i}p_{i}\left(\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|^{2}+\sigma^{2}\right)% +B_{i}^{2}p_{i}^{2}\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|^{2},italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,

using this and recalling the definition of B𝐵Bitalic_B, we get

𝔼⁢[∑i=1n‖ai‖2]𝔼delimited-[]superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛superscriptnormsubscript𝑎𝑖2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\sum_{i=1}^{n}\left\|a_{i}\right\|^{2}\right]blackboard_E [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ≤\displaystyle\leq≤ B⁢‖∇f⁢(x)‖2+B⁢σ2+‖∇f⁢(x)‖2⁢∑i=1nBi2⁢pi2.𝐵superscriptnorm∇𝑓𝑥2𝐵superscript𝜎2superscriptnorm∇𝑓𝑥2superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛superscriptsubscript𝐵𝑖2superscriptsubscript𝑝𝑖2\displaystyle B\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|^{2}+B\sigma^{2}+\left\|\nabla f(x)% \right\|^{2}\sum_{i=1}^{n}B_{i}^{2}p_{i}^{2}.italic_B ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_B italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

Next

⟨ai,aj⟩⁢=(7,9)⁢Bi⁢pi⁢Bj⁢pj⁢‖∇f⁢(x)‖2,subscript𝑎𝑖subscript𝑎𝑗79subscript𝐵𝑖subscript𝑝𝑖subscript𝐵𝑗subscript𝑝𝑗superscriptnorm∇𝑓𝑥2\displaystyle\left\langle a_{i},a_{j}\right\rangle\overset{\left(\ref{a_ia_j},% \ref{b_ib_j}\right)}{=}B_{i}p_{i}B_{j}p_{j}\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|^{2},⟨ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⟩ start_OVERACCENT ( , ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG = end_ARG italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,

and finally,

𝔼⁢[‖g⁢(x)‖2]𝔼delimited-[]superscriptnorm𝑔𝑥2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\left\|g(x)\right\|^{2}\right]blackboard_E [ ∥ italic_g ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] =\displaystyle== 1B2⁢𝔼⁢[∑i=1n‖ai‖2+∑i≠j⟨ai,aj⟩]1superscript𝐵2𝔼delimited-[]superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛superscriptnormsubscript𝑎𝑖2subscript𝑖𝑗subscript𝑎𝑖subscript𝑎𝑗\displaystyle\frac{1}{B^{2}}\mathbb{E}\left[\sum_{i=1}^{n}\left\|a_{i}\right\|% ^{2}+\sum_{i\neq j}\left\langle a_{i},a_{j}\right\rangle\right]divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG blackboard_E [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ≠ italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⟨ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⟩ ]
≤\displaystyle\leq≤ 1B2⁢[B⁢‖∇f⁢(x)‖2+B⁢σ2+(∑i=1nBi2⁢pi2+∑i≠jBi⁢pi⁢Bj⁢pj)⁢‖∇f⁢(x)‖2]1superscript𝐵2delimited-[]𝐵superscriptnorm∇𝑓𝑥2𝐵superscript𝜎2superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛superscriptsubscript𝐵𝑖2superscriptsubscript𝑝𝑖2subscript𝑖𝑗subscript𝐵𝑖subscript𝑝𝑖subscript𝐵𝑗subscript𝑝𝑗superscriptnorm∇𝑓𝑥2\displaystyle\frac{1}{B^{2}}\left[B\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|^{2}+B\sigma^{2}+% \left(\sum_{i=1}^{n}B_{i}^{2}p_{i}^{2}+\sum_{i\neq j}B_{i}p_{i}B_{j}p_{j}% \right)\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|^{2}\right]divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG [ italic_B ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_B italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ( ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ≠ italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]
=\displaystyle== 1B2⁢(B+B2)⁢‖∇f⁢(x)‖2+σ2B1superscript𝐵2𝐵superscript𝐵2superscriptnorm∇𝑓𝑥2superscript𝜎2𝐵\displaystyle\frac{1}{B^{2}}\left(B+B^{2}\right)\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|^{2}% +\frac{\sigma^{2}}{B}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ( italic_B + italic_B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG
≤\displaystyle\leq≤ 2⁢‖∇f⁢(x)‖2+σ2B.2superscriptnorm∇𝑓𝑥2superscript𝜎2𝐵\displaystyle 2\left\|\nabla f(x)\right\|^{2}+\frac{\sigma^{2}}{B}.2 ∥ ∇ italic_f ( italic_x ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_B end_ARG .

∎

G.2 Proof of Theorem 4.5

The following lemma gives time complexity for any choice of B1,…,Bnsubscript𝐵1…subscript𝐵𝑛B_{1},\ldots,B_{n}italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and t=(t1,…,tn)𝑡subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑛t=\left(t_{1},\ldots,t_{n}\right)italic_t = ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) in MindFlayer SGD.

Lemma G.3 (Proof in Section G.2.1).

Assume that Assumptions 4.1, 4.2 and 4.3 hold. Let B=∑i=1npi⁢Bi𝐵superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛subscript𝑝𝑖subscript𝐵𝑖B=\sum_{i=1}^{n}p_{i}B_{i}italic_B = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and γ=12⁢L⁢min⁡{1,ε⁢Bσ2}𝛾12𝐿1𝜀𝐵superscript𝜎2\gamma=\frac{1}{2L}\min\left\{1,\frac{\varepsilon B}{\sigma^{2}}\right\}italic_γ = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_L end_ARG roman_min { 1 , divide start_ARG italic_ε italic_B end_ARG start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG } in Method 7. Then after

T𝖬𝗂𝗇𝖽𝖥𝗅𝖺𝗒𝖾𝗋𝖲𝖦𝖣⁢(t)≥maxi∈[n]⁡{Bi⁢(τi+ti)}⁢max⁡{1,σ2ε⁢B}⁢8⁢L⁢(f⁢(x0)−finf)εsubscript𝑇𝖬𝗂𝗇𝖽𝖥𝗅𝖺𝗒𝖾𝗋𝖲𝖦𝖣𝑡subscript𝑖delimited-[]𝑛subscript𝐵𝑖subscript𝜏𝑖subscript𝑡𝑖1superscript𝜎2𝜀𝐵8𝐿𝑓subscript𝑥0superscript𝑓infimum𝜀T_{{{\sf\footnotesize\color[rgb]{0.75390625,0,0}\definecolor[named]{% pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0.75390625,0,0}MindFlayerSGD}}}(t)\geq\max_{i\in[n]}\{B_{% i}\left(\tau_{i}+t_{i}\right)\}\max\left\{1,\frac{\sigma^{2}}{\varepsilon B}% \right\}\frac{8L\left(f(x_{0})-f^{\inf}\right)}{\varepsilon}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_MindFlayerSGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ≥ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ∈ [ italic_n ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) } roman_max { 1 , divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_ε italic_B end_ARG } divide start_ARG 8 italic_L ( italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_inf end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG

seconds, the method guarantees to find an ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ-stationary point.

Now we are ready to prove the theorem.

Theorem 4.5.

Assume that Assumptions 4.1, 4.2 and 4.3 hold. Let B=∑i=1npi⁢Bi𝐵superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑛subscript𝑝𝑖subscript𝐵𝑖B=\sum_{i=1}^{n}p_{i}B_{i}italic_B = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and γ=12⁢L⁢min⁡{1,ε⁢Bσ2}𝛾12𝐿1𝜀𝐵superscript𝜎2\gamma=\frac{1}{2L}\min\left\{1,\frac{\varepsilon B}{\sigma^{2}}\right\}italic_γ = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_L end_ARG roman_min { 1 , divide start_ARG italic_ε italic_B end_ARG start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG } in Method 7. Let t=(t1,…,tn)𝑡subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑛t=\left(t_{1},\ldots,t_{n}\right)italic_t = ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), t1,…,tn≥0subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑛0t_{1},\ldots,t_{n}\geq 0italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≥ 0. Without loss of generality assume that 0<τ1+t1≤⋯≤τn+tn0subscript𝜏1subscript𝑡1⋯subscript𝜏𝑛subscript𝑡𝑛0<\tau_{1}+t_{1}\leq\cdots\leq\tau_{n}+t_{n}0 < italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ ⋯ ≤ italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Let

t⁢(m)=(∑j=1mpjτj+tj)−1⁢(S+∑j=1mpj),𝑡𝑚superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝑗1𝑚subscript𝑝𝑗subscript𝜏𝑗subscript𝑡𝑗1𝑆superscriptsubscript𝑗1𝑚subscript𝑝𝑗t(m)=\left(\sum_{j=1}^{m}\frac{p_{j}}{\tau_{j}+t_{j}}\right)^{-1}\left(S+\sum_% {j=1}^{m}p_{j}\right),italic_t ( italic_m ) = ( ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_S + ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ,

where S=max⁡{1,σ2ε}𝑆1superscript𝜎2𝜀S=\max\left\{1,\frac{\sigma^{2}}{\varepsilon}\right\}italic_S = roman_max { 1 , divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG }. Let m∗=arg⁡minm∈[n]⁡t⁢(m)superscript𝑚subscript𝑚delimited-[]𝑛𝑡𝑚m^{*}=\arg\min_{m\in[n]}t(m)italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ∈ [ italic_n ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ( italic_m ), if there are several minimizers we take the smallest one. Put

Bi=⌈bi⌉,bi={t⁢(m∗)τi+ti−1,if⁢i≤m∗,0,if⁢i>m∗.formulae-sequencesubscript𝐵𝑖subscript𝑏𝑖subscript𝑏𝑖cases𝑡superscript𝑚subscript𝜏𝑖subscript𝑡𝑖1if𝑖superscript𝑚0if𝑖superscript𝑚B_{i}=\lceil b_{i}\rceil,\quad b_{i}=\begin{cases}\frac{t(m^{*})}{\tau_{i}+t_{% i}}-1,&\text{if}\enspace i\leq m^{*},\\ 0,&\text{if}\enspace i>m^{*}.\end{cases}italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ⌈ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⌉ , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { start_ROW start_CELL divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG - 1 , end_CELL start_CELL if italic_i ≤ italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 , end_CELL start_CELL if italic_i > italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT . end_CELL end_ROW

Then, MindFlayer SGD guarantees to find an ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ-stationary point after

T𝖬𝗂𝗇𝖽𝖥𝗅𝖺𝗒𝖾𝗋𝖲𝖦𝖣⁢(t)≥8×minm∈[n]⁡{(1m⁢∑j=1mpjτj+tj)−1⁢(Sm+1m⁢∑j=1mpj)⁢Δ⁢Lε}subscript𝑇𝖬𝗂𝗇𝖽𝖥𝗅𝖺𝗒𝖾𝗋𝖲𝖦𝖣𝑡8subscript𝑚delimited-[]𝑛superscript1𝑚superscriptsubscript𝑗1𝑚subscript𝑝𝑗subscript𝜏𝑗subscript𝑡𝑗1𝑆𝑚1𝑚superscriptsubscript𝑗1𝑚subscript𝑝𝑗Δ𝐿𝜀T_{{{\sf\footnotesize\color[rgb]{0.75390625,0,0}\definecolor[named]{% pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0.75390625,0,0}MindFlayerSGD}}}(t)\geq 8\times\min_{m\in[% n]}\left\{\left(\frac{1}{m}\sum_{j=1}^{m}\frac{p_{j}}{\tau_{j}+t_{j}}\right)^{% -1}\left(\frac{S}{m}+\frac{1}{m}\sum_{j=1}^{m}p_{j}\right)\frac{\Delta L}{% \varepsilon}\right\}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_MindFlayerSGD end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ≥ 8 × roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ∈ [ italic_n ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_m end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_S end_ARG start_ARG italic_m end_ARG + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_m end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG roman_Δ italic_L end_ARG start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG }

seconds, where Δ=f⁢(x0)−finfΔ𝑓subscript𝑥0superscript𝑓infimum\Delta=f(x_{0})-f^{\inf}roman_Δ = italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_inf end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

Proof.

First we show that Bisubscript𝐵𝑖B_{i}italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-s are valid choice, i.e. bi>0subscript𝑏𝑖0b_{i}>0italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 for i≤m∗𝑖superscript𝑚i\leq m^{*}italic_i ≤ italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. If m∗=1superscript𝑚1m^{*}=1italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 1, then t⁢(1)=τ1+t1p1⁢(S+p1)𝑡1subscript𝜏1subscript𝑡1subscript𝑝1𝑆subscript𝑝1t(1)=\frac{\tau_{1}+t_{1}}{p_{1}}(S+p_{1})italic_t ( 1 ) = divide start_ARG italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ( italic_S + italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), thus b1=Sp1>0subscript𝑏1𝑆subscript𝑝10b_{1}=\frac{S}{p_{1}}>0italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG italic_S end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG > 0. If m∗>1superscript𝑚1m^{*}>1italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > 1, then, by its definition, t⁢(m∗)<t⁢(m∗−1)𝑡superscript𝑚𝑡superscript𝑚1t(m^{*})<t(m^{*}-1)italic_t ( italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) < italic_t ( italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 ). This implies

(∑j=1m∗pjτj+tj)−1⁢(S+∑j=1m∗pj)<(∑j=1m∗−1pjτj+tj)−1⁢(S+∑j=1m∗−1pj),superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝑗1superscript𝑚subscript𝑝𝑗subscript𝜏𝑗subscript𝑡𝑗1𝑆superscriptsubscript𝑗1superscript𝑚subscript𝑝𝑗superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝑗1superscript𝑚1subscript𝑝𝑗subscript𝜏𝑗subscript𝑡𝑗1𝑆superscriptsubscript𝑗1superscript𝑚1subscript𝑝𝑗\left(\sum_{j=1}^{m^{*}}\frac{p_{j}}{\tau_{j}+t_{j}}\right)^{-1}\left(S+\sum_{% j=1}^{m^{*}}p_{j}\right)<\left(\sum_{j=1}^{m^{*}-1}\frac{p_{j}}{\tau_{j}+t_{j}% }\right)^{-1}\left(S+\sum_{j=1}^{m^{*}-1}p_{j}\right),( ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_S + ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) < ( ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_S + ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ,

leading to
